question: how am i supposed to feel when i forgive someone ? my mom made a lot of mistakes a couple years back , and i can ' t seem to forgive her . i want to say that it ' s okay , but i can ' t . i feel like even if i did forgive her , i wouldn ' t be able to say it to her face .
accepted_response: Please allow yourself to experience your feelings without judgment when forgiving, as it's a personal journey that may bring a mix of relief, sadness, anger, or even confusion, and it's okay to take your time to process these emotions.
rejected_response: Acknowledge your feelings, forgive her at your own pace, and communicate your forgiveness when you feel ready.

question: how can i help my boyfriend ' s anger issues ? i have an emotionally abusive relationship . we have been together for a year and a half . he got out of prison exactly a year ago and a half ago , and we have a infant . i love my boyfriend , and i don ' t want to leave without fighting for this first . he ' s an emotionally disconnected person . we never say “ i love you ” to each other . every fight is worse than the last one , and i don ' t know what to do . he doesn ' t let me speak because he ' s louder than me , and that makes me feel frustrated . i have another problem : english is my second language . i pay half of the bills , and every time i want to speak to him , he kicks me out of the house . he apologizes sometimes . i feel like i ' m the only one fighting for this . he agreed to have counseling .
accepted_response: Please consider seeking professional help immediately, ideally a counselor or a therapist, to address your situation and remember, your safety and well-being are paramount.
rejected_response: Seek professional counseling immediately, establish a safety plan for you and your infant, communicate your feelings directly and calmly when he's in a receptive mood, and consider joining a support group for those in abusive relationships.

question: how can i open up to the ones i love ? i have been pushing people away all my life . i finally have a great boyfriend who loves me , but i keep pushing him away and i don ' t want to . i need to learn to open up .
accepted_response: Kindly consider sharing your feelings and fears with your loved ones, as this could help you build stronger connections and stop pushing them away.
rejected_response: Start by acknowledging your feelings, then express them to your loved ones; practice vulnerability, it's okay to let your guard down and let people in.

question: how do i repair my friendship ? my best friend and i were pranking her friend , and i told her to tell him that she likes him . she said no , but i forced her . after she told him , he told her that he likes her too . their friendship is ruined because of me . she won ' t forgive me , and i feel really guilty . i feel like crying .
accepted_response: Please consider reaching out to your friend, expressing your deep regret for your actions, and sincerely asking for her forgiveness.
rejected_response: Acknowledge your mistake, apologize sincerely to your friend for the pressure you exerted, show understanding for her feelings, and give her time to process the situation, all while expressing your commitment to make things right.

question: how can i resist the urge to cut ? when i ' m sad and alone , i want to cut myself .
accepted_response: Please reach out to a trusted individual when you're feeling this way, and try to engage in activities that you find calming or enjoyable.
rejected_response: Reach out to someone you trust, channel your emotions into a constructive activity like art or exercise, and remind yourself of your worth and strength when the urge to self-harm presents itself.

question: can our marriage still be saved ? in 2008 my former husband of 14 years walked away from my life and we ' ve been separated ever since . we have always been together sexually and both have experienced sleeping with others . i stopped because i wanted my marriage to work out but he did not . if he stops sleeping with other women , can our marriage be saved ? or should we just part ways ? i still care deeply about him after all that i did and he has done . but he is seeing someone else on and off for years now . will our marriage still be saved if he decides that he wants to try to do so ?
accepted_response: Please consider seeking professional marriage counseling to explore the complexities of your relationship and to determine whether reconciliation is a healthy and viable option for both of you.
rejected_response: Acknowledge your feelings, understand the complexity of your situation, and seek professional help. Discuss with your former husband, if he is willing, and decide together whether to revive your marriage or part ways. Remember, your happiness and mental health are paramount.

question: is it wrong to be antisocial around people ? i ' ve been getting told lately by my partner that it ’ s embarrassing that i ' m so antisocial around his family and friends . i believe it ' s because i ' m not as social as him .
accepted_response: Please consider expressing your feelings to your partner and explaining that everyone has different social comfort levels, and it's okay if yours isn't the same as his.
rejected_response: Acknowledge your feelings, but also consider exploring new ways to interact with people, respecting your comfort zone and working towards improving the dynamics between you, your partner, and his family.

question: i ' m seriously unhappy with everything in my life but i know i don ' t have any reason to feel this way i can ' t even smile or fake one . i can ' t feel happiness about anything and i can ' t show love towards another person not even my girlfriend . i hate myself sometimes . all i see is ugly . i can ' t get over the loss of a loved one and i ' m not close to my family . what can i do ?
accepted_response: Please consider seeking professional help, like a therapist or counselor, because they can provide you with the necessary tools to navigate through your feelings and help you regain a sense of happiness and self-love.
rejected_response: Acknowledge your feelings, seek professional help, express your emotions to your loved ones, and try to reconnect with your family, because it's okay to feel what you're feeling and there are ways to heal from your loss and regain happiness.

question: does my daughter have a mental disability ? my daughter is in later elementary school . she can ' t color in the lines . her words jumble together when she writes unless there are big spaces or she skips lines .
accepted_response: Please consider seeking a professional evaluation for your daughter as her difficulties with writing and coloring could signify a learning disorder, not a mental disability.
rejected_response: Seek a professional assessment to determine if your daughter has a learning disability, as her struggles with fine motor skills and writing could indicate some form of dysgraphia or another learning issue.

question: why am i so protective of my friends and family ? any time my family and friends are in an altercation , i ’ m the one who steps in . i ’ m the one they call to fight for them . i do this even though i have a tough time trusting the people i ’ m fighting for . i ’ m only in my early 20s .
accepted_response: Please take a moment to appreciate your instinct to protect those you care about, but also consider setting boundaries and working on trust issues to ensure your own emotional well-being.
rejected_response: Consider your deep-rooted love for your friends and family, seek understanding of your feelings, and explore trust-building exercises to foster healthier relationships.

question: how can i deal with gender dysphoria in a positive way ? i ' m transgender , i know i am , but i ' ve only told a few friends . i know i can ' t tell my family because of previous conversations we ' ve had . they just wouldn ' t accept it . my gender dysphoria is getting really difficult to deal with on my own . i need some strategies for dealing with it . what should i do ?
accepted_response: Please consider seeking professional support, such as a therapist who specializes in gender issues, and continue to confide in your trusted friends for emotional support while exploring various coping strategies such as mindfulness and self-acceptance exercises.
rejected_response: Seek out supportive communities, consider professional help such as a gender therapist, practice self-care and self-love, and engage in activities that affirm your identified gender, as these can be powerful tools in navigating and managing your gender dysphoria.

question: how do i not be angry all the time ? my roommate is a unapologetic person who doesn ' t care who she hurts . she never apologizes to me or my family . she made me lose my temper today to the point where i was using swear words in front of my mom and brother .
accepted_response: Please consider practicing calming techniques such as deep breathing or meditation to manage your anger, and assertively communicate your feelings to your roommate without resorting to aggression or harsh words.
rejected_response: Practice mindfulness, communicate your feelings calmly to your roommate, and consider seeking professional help if the anger persists.

question: is my therapist telling my abuser the results of my test a hipaa violation ? after a domestic abuse situation , i went to a therapist , and then my husband went . the therapist discussed her assessment of borderline personality disorder with me . she then told my abuser the results of my tests .
accepted_response: Please consult a legal expert regarding potential HIPAA violations, as it seems your therapist may have breached confidentiality by sharing your test results without your consent.
rejected_response: Demand an immediate cessation of such behavior from your therapist, because sharing your confidential health information without your consent is indeed a violation of HIPAA.

question: my boyfriend ' s family expects him to take them on dates , and he doesn ' t think anything ' s wrong i have been dating my boyfriend for eight years . we met in college off away from home and things went from good to bad when i met his family who treats him like he is their man . they expect him to take them on dates like to the movies and out to eat when they come around , and he thinks it ' s okay .
accepted_response: Please consider discussing your feelings with your boyfriend, emphasizing the importance of setting boundaries with his family for the health and progress of your relationship.
rejected_response: Recognize your feelings, communicate openly with your boyfriend about your concerns, and seek to understand his perspective, as addressing these concerns directly and honestly can help to strengthen your relationship.

question: how should i deal with my mom ' s controlling behavior ? i ' m an adult , facing problems with my mom . she ' s way too controlling . she decides things for me , disregarding whatever i say . i tried explaining my side to her calmly , but she eventually gets angry and doesn ' t wish to listen to me regardless of how i speak to her .
accepted_response: Please consider setting firm boundaries with your mother while expressing your feelings and needs respectfully, bearing in mind that her actions may stem from concern rather than control.
rejected_response: Establish your boundaries firmly, communicate your feelings openly and respectfully, and seek professional help if necessary.

question: my girlfriend always brings up past events and talks negatively about them any time things get heated , the past gets brought up . i raise my voice at her to try to get a point across . she asks open - ended questions but always has to turn my own answer against me . she ' s seven months pregnant . i have drank in the past , but i ' m not dependent on alcohol — i only drink at social events .
accepted_response: Please consider discussing with your girlfriend the need to focus on the present instead of the past during disagreements, and kindly remind yourself to maintain a calm voice for a healthier communication, while also reassuring her of your control over alcohol use.
rejected_response: Acknowledge your girlfriend's feelings, communicate openly about your concerns, avoid raising your voice, answer her open-ended questions honestly, support her during her pregnancy, and continue to maintain your responsible drinking habits.

question: i have voices in my head they don ' t go away , and i feel like i ' m going crazy . does that ever stop ? can it be a symptom of medication ?
accepted_response: Please consider reaching out to your healthcare provider immediately, as these symptoms could indicate a reaction to medication or another health concern, and remember, there's no need to navigate these feelings alone.
rejected_response: Seek professional help immediately, discuss your symptoms with your healthcare provider, consider the possibility that this might be a side effect of your medication, and remember, you're not alone in this.

question: how can i train myself to stop eating when i ' m full ? i have no self control over food . most people stop when they ' ve had enough , but i keep eating for the pleasure of it . especially with sweets - i ' m never done eating dessert .
accepted_response: Please consider practicing mindful eating by paying close attention to your body's hunger and fullness cues, and also try to cultivate a balanced relationship with food where pleasure is derived from its quality, not just its quantity, especially with sweets.
rejected_response: Recognize your body's signals of fullness, learn to differentiate between physical hunger and emotional hunger, practice mindful eating, and allow yourself to enjoy sweets in moderation without feeling guilty or overindulging.

question: i ' m scared to go to a doctor or take anti - depressants a friend of mine taking psychology advised i go to my doctor to check if i have major depressive disorder . i ' m afraid of the consequences of doing so . if i do become diagnosed with major depressive disorder , won ’ t that go on my records ? i will never be able to become a counselor along with a list of other things i may be prohibited from . i ’ m also afraid of taking any anti - depressants . this year , my doctor gave me some for a " dislocated hip . " i had a severe reaction and passed out moments after taking them . everyone i know who has taken anti - depressants says it ’ s a bad idea all around and you ’ re better getting treatment without them . i ’ m concerned they might take me to a clinic and force me to take medication because i am unable to make decisions on my own . i ’ m not really suicidal , but i am not really taking care of myself either . someone also told me they still use electroshock therapy . i ’ m not keen on that . i ’ m wondering if i am better off just getting self - help and working things out on my own .
accepted_response: Please consider seeking professional help, knowing that your medical history is confidential and won't impede your career aspirations, and remember that medication and treatment approaches are always decided upon collaboratively, taking into account your unique circumstances and concerns.
rejected_response: Acknowledge your fears, but don't let them deter you from seeking professional help. Remember, diagnosis doesn't restrict your career options, and treatment always respects your consent. Don't base decisions on others' experiences or fears about outdated practices, instead, consult with your doctor to discuss your concerns and explore treatment options. Self-care is important, but professional guidance is invaluable when dealing with potential mental health issues.

question: how do i assert myself with a boss who called me co - dependent ? my boss took over some work i ' d begun . concerned that she had doubts about my work , i asked her for feedback . i assured her that i did my utmost for customer service , and asked if i was deficient . she then said this was me being co - dependent .
accepted_response: Kindly consider expressing your feelings about her statement directly and respectfully, while also requesting clarification on what she specifically meant by calling you co-dependent.
rejected_response: Seek clarity by asking your boss to explain her perspective about you being co-dependent, express your feelings without accusing, and request for a constructive feedback on your performance.

question: my ex - boyfriend wouldn ' t let me have my daughter because i didn ' t know my stepdaughter ' s pick - up details i am constantly having problems with the same two people who will always be in my life . i had a daughter with my ex - boyfriend . i am now married , and my husband ’ s ex - girlfriend is involved with my ex - boyfriend . they also have a daughter together . my issue is that there is always drama . i am pregnant , and i told my ex - boyfriend that i don ' t want any drama or arguments . i want to get along as much as possible , and he agreed . however , we just had an incident where my ex - boyfriend started discussing drop - off details about my stepdaughter . i told him that he needed to ask my husband because i can ' t make decisions about my stepdaughter regarding the matter . that led to an argument . i told him all my concern is when i pick up my daughter . my stepdaughter ’ s pick - up details are between my husband and his ex - girlfriend . i especially told him i didn ' t want to be involved . somehow , he turned it around and then wanted to change the schedule we agreed on . he threatened me and
accepted_response: Please endeavor to maintain calm and open communication lines with your ex-boyfriend and your husband's ex-girlfriend, focusing on the well-being of the children involved, while also asserting your boundaries with respect to matters concerning your stepdaughter.
rejected_response: Take a deep breath, find your calm, and then reach out to both your ex-boyfriend and your husband's ex-girlfriend. Establish clear boundaries about your respective roles and responsibilities, focusing on the well-being of the children. Remember, arguments solve nothing, but open communication and understanding can help everyone involved.

question: how can i be with the boy who liked me ? there ' s this boy who asked me out awhile ago . i said no because my friends and family would think weirdly of me . how do i be with him and tell him and tell my friends ?
accepted_response: Please, consider sharing your feelings openly with this boy, while also having a respectful and honest conversation with your friends and family about your decision.
rejected_response: Acknowledge your feelings for the boy, communicate with him honestly about your feelings, and share your decision with your family and friends without fearing their judgment.

question: my sexual partner wants me to reimburse him on a hotel room i was having a sexual relationship with a coworker . he decided he was going to get a hotel room for the weekend . before i got paid , i told him i would have $ 25 . 00 , which i thought i would . but when i saw my paycheck , i could not pay the $ 25 . 00 . he says i lied to him about it . he wants me to reimburse him $ 25 . 00 for the hotel room he decided to get . he stayed at the hotel , and i left . i don ' t think it ' s right that he want me to reimburse him $ 25 . 00 for a hotel room he wanted to get in the first place . he is out of town right now and texted me yesterday telling me i am a liar and that i should never said i was going to have $ 25 . 00 when i knew i wasn ' t . i told him i had to pay rent and my rent was late . he texted me saying i need to get two or three jobs .
accepted_response: Please consider communicating openly with your partner about your financial constraints and the misunderstanding, while also asserting your own perspective in a respectful manner.
rejected_response: Take a deep breath, reconsider the situation, and engage in a calm and open conversation with him about your financial struggles and why you couldn't pay the $25.00, and remember to stand your ground about your initial arrangements.

question: is it a normal practice for a team of doctors who are connected by state or profession to discontinue your treatment ? they discontinued treatment for no apparent reason after they thought to diagnose me with schizophrenia .
accepted_response: Please consider reaching out to your healthcare team for a comprehensive explanation, as it is crucial to understand that doctors generally discontinue treatment based on a calculated professional decision, not without reason.

question: is it possible for a couple to overcome cheating if it only happened once ? my fiance and i have been together for 3 years and our relationship has always been good . the only issue we had was that he felt like he wasn ' t getting enough sexual attention from me . i recently found out he cheated on me with another women . he says he wants his family back but i ' m confused on what to do . is it possible for us to get past the cheating , or should i just move on ?
accepted_response: Please consider engaging in open dialogue with your fiancé, seeking professional counseling, and taking the necessary time to heal, as it's entirely possible to recover from a single incident of infidelity, provided there is remorse, honesty, and a commitment to rebuild trust.
rejected_response: Acknowledge your feelings, seek professional help together, and commit to rebuilding trust to overcome the hurdle, but remember, your decision is valid, whether to move forward with the relationship or choose to walk away.

question: my boyfriend says he doesn ' t like to do things with me because we fight too much he owns his own business . sometimes , he stays out all night but doesn ' t tell me . we have a son together , and i get to stay home with him . he says i complain too much about what he ' s doing . we ' ve been together a year and a half . i got pregnant after being together for a month . we moved in together when i had my son in july . everything was great , and then he started the staying out . he then started not spending time with either of us . i just don ' t know if i ' m doing something wrong . we ' ve talked and he says this is just how he is , but he wasn ' t like this before .

question: my girlfriend broke up with me but i want her back . what do i do ? me and my girlfriend just broke up . she said she loves me but is not in love anymore . this came out of nowhere . we seemed so happy together . it all started when she went to missouri to visit her family . the first week she was there she was fine then once she went to this one sister ’ s house everything changed . that ' s when she told me she loved me but was not in love with me anymore . i thought maybe it was just because she missed her family and she just wanted to be home because she told me that she could not leave them again . then she told me to come to her in missouri . so that ' s what i did . i quit my job i dropped everything , said goodbye to my family in florida and drove 15 straight hours to be with her . once i got there everything was fine again . she apologized for everything and said she didn ' t mean any of it then we were good for about a week . then she went back to saying she didn ’ t love me anymore and had no feelings for me . the only thing that really gets me and makes me not want to accept this is that now she is

rejected_response: Reflect on your emotions and allow yourself time to heal. Engage in open dialogue with her, expressing your feelings respectfully and honestly. Understand her feelings may have changed, and respect her decision. Use this as an opportunity to grow personally.

question: how do i kick my stepdaughter out of our house because she isn ' t honoring boundaries set for her ? she ' s in her early 20s , and she has a toddler .

question: i think i empathize too much i empathize so much , even with characters on tv or in video games , that i actually feel physical pain . this has made life difficult to say the least . i believe i have an actually case of something called hyper empathy disorder . but since it ' s such a new disorder i can ' t find any information about it . could this be what is going on with me ?

question: how do i find out the cause of my depression and anxiety ? i have been feeling more and more down for over a month . i have started having trouble sleeping due to panic attacks , but they are almost never triggered by something that i know of .
